A

addSecretForAuthToken() - Method in interface org.kawanfw.commons.api.server.CommonsConfigurator
Allows to define a secret value that will enforce the security of the authentication defined in computeAuthToken.
addSecretForAuthToken() - Method in class org.kawanfw.commons.api.server.DefaultCommonsConfigurator
Returns a concatenation of server specific values that won't change during the JVM life and that client side can not guess in order to secure computeAuthToken().
allowCallAfterAnalysis(String, Connection, String, List<Object>) - Method in class org.kawanfw.file.api.server.DefaultFileConfigurator
 
allowCallAfterAnalysis(String, Connection, String, List<Object>) - Method in interface org.kawanfw.file.api.server.FileConfigurator
Allows, for the passed client username, to define a specific piece of Java code to analyze the method name and it's parameter values before allowing or not it's execution.
available() - Method in class org.kawanfw.file.api.client.RemoteInputStream
Returns an estimate of the number of bytes that can be read (or skipped over) from this input stream without blocking by the next invocation of a method for this input stream.
